questions.text: A patient presents with a breast lump, and imaging (X-ray mammography) along with histopathology confirms a diagnosis of breast cancer. She has a family history of breast cancer involving two relatives and has a 29-year-old daughter. Which gene should be tested to assess hereditary breast cancer risk in this patient?
A 25 year old male presents with Pain starting from umbilicus moving to RIF, Fever, nausea and rebound tenderness. His WBC count is 14,000/cmm. What is the Alvarado score?

A 65-year-old patient undergoes colonoscopy for evaluation of altered bowel habits. A 6 cm colonic mass is identified and biopsied. Histopathology confirms adenocarcinoma that is confined to the mucosal layer, with no evidence of invasion into the submucosa or beyond. Imaging studies show no lymph node involvement or distant metastasis. Based on this information, what is the most appropriate TNM stage of this tumor?
Not a C/I of breast conservation surgery?
